comments:
Build ID: M20060629-1905

Steps To Reproduce:
I'm developing some Eclipse plugins and I'm testing those plugins in a minimal environment (ie not all default Eclipse plugins enabled in the launch configuration).

Once in this reduced Eclipse instance, I open the Preferences, then select Run/Debug > Launching > Launch Configurations. I get an error message "The current displayed page contains invalid values". The stack trace logged in the .log file follows.

More information:
A quick look under the debbuger shows that LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.createTypeFiltering() contains the following code:

[...]
LaunchGroupExtension[] groups = new LaunchGroupExtension[] {				   DebugUIPlugin.getDefault().getLaunchConfigurationManager().getLaunchGroup(DEBUG_LAUNCH_GROUP),	DebugUIPlugin.getDefault().getLaunchConfigurationManager().getLaunchGroup(EXT_BUILDER_GROUP)};
tviewer.addFilter(new MultiLaunchGroupFilter(groups));
[...]

The MultiLaunchGroupFilter is thus initialized with an array of two elements. In my case the second element is null. The comment of getLaunchGroup() indicates that it can returns null, so it looks like a possible configuration.

However, MultiLaunchGroupFilter.equalModes() seems to assume that all groups are not null (when accessing 'fGroups[i].getMode()'):

private boolean equalModes(ILaunchConfigurationType type) {
   for(int i = 0; i < fGroups.length; i++) {
	if(type.supportsMode(fGroups[i].getMode())) {
		return true;
	}
   }
   return false;
}


When looking at the content of LaunchConfigurationManager.fLaunchGroups, I see only three entries in the hashtable: 
  org.eclipse.debug.ui.launchGroup.profile 
  org.eclipse.debug.ui.launchGroup.run
  org.eclipse.debug.ui.launchGroup.debug

but not org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.launchGroup. 

Of course I suspect that the plugin responsible for the "Extenal Tools" was not loaded (don't know exactly which plugin it is, but I cannot see the icon in the UI). I'd however expect the code not to assume that this plugin is present if this plugin is not required ("Validate Plug-in Set" in the launch configuration does not complain).


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.MultiLaunchGroupFilter.equalModes(MultiLaunchGroupFilter.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.MultiLaunchGroupFilter.select(MultiLaunchGroupFilter.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ViewerFilter.filter(ViewerFilter.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.getFilteredChildren(StructuredViewer.java:872)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.getSortedChildren(StructuredViewer.java:984)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefreshAll(TableViewer.java:870)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:818)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.internalRefresh(TableViewer.java:807)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer$7.run(StructuredViewer.java:1388)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.preservingSelection(StructuredViewer.java:1323)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.CheckboxTableViewer.preservingSelection(CheckboxTableViewer.java:295)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1386)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.refresh(StructuredViewer.java:1345)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer.inputChanged(TableViewer.java:767)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ContentViewer.setInput(ContentViewer.java:250)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.StructuredViewer.setInput(StructuredViewer.java:1542)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.preferences.LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.createTypeFiltering(LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.preferences.LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.createContents(LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.java:196)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.createControl(PreferencePage.java:233)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.preferences.LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.createControl(LaunchConfigurationsPreferencePage.java:168)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog.createPageControl(PreferenceDialog.java:1403)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$12.run(PreferenceDialog.java:1162)
[...]

fixed in HEAD, we were optimistically adding launch group extensions to the filter listing without checking to see if they were null or not (possibly passing an array full of nulls). As getLaunchGroup(..) is spec'd to return null we should be checking for it.
